title: Yasuo's Face When he sees the patch notes of 5.23

replies.body:
Don't you DARE be talking shit about mah waifu you pathetic plebs.
                                                                                                   With love
                                                                                                            -Rito
I thought Riven was Rito's Waifu?
Lee Sin.
Except the part where basically no offensive keystone mastery benefits him very well at all.
Well I mean with the new items I hear Lee can effectively go full damage and CDR without worrying about anything.
except the part where lee gets 2-3 shot? Mhm...
If the games are ending at around the 20-30 mark and Lee is constantly ganking with his full damage build, he won't need to worry about the itemless champions how he's gold starving.
But only if he doesn't 2-shot them first
I think there is something to be said that he doesn't apparently NEED a keystone mastery that much.
Riven is husbando, Yasuo is waifu.

we COULD expect nerfs... but will we see them on a champ that makes #BIGLC$PLAY$? After all, {{champion:92}}'s update is all but trashed at this point and {{champion:238}} is getting increased distance on his shadow since his win rate dropped.

> [{quoted}](name=Blue Moon Wolf,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=44Qgl98f,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-11-14T18:00:34.995+0000)
>
> we COULD expect nerfs... but will we see them on a champ that makes #BIGLC$PLAY$? After all, {{champion:92}}'s update is all but trashed at this point and {{champion:238}} is getting increased distance on his shadow since his win rate dropped.

Zed got a massive and unwarranted nerf.
That Attack Speed nerf was soooooooooooooo bad!

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=44Qgl98f,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-11-14T19:43:18.697+0000)
>
> That Attack Speed nerf was soooooooooooooo bad!

The ignorance is fucking incredible. His Q Shadow combo was made clunky as hell. Call it a bug if you want, it added a lot of power to Zed's kit and he recieved no compensation for being nerfed at a time that he clearly doesn't need nerfs.

And I was never referring to nerfs before that, but if you want to go that far back then you should know that the .5 second delay after Death Mark is a massive nerf lategame, which Zed is bad at anyway.
That didn't stop riot from leaving Darius pull... o wait.

that wasn't even a bug. There's been numerous times where Riot has called something a bug where it clearly wasn't a bug. Caitlyn traps giving sight for instance... if that's a bug, then I suppose shaco traps, and nid traps giving sight is a bug too?

> Call it a bug **if you want**

It's not about me wanting to call it a bug, it was a bug and a severe one since you could spam everything at once when you were not intended to do so (and that means that Zed was balanced around not being able to do that), I guess we should have let Garen deal damage scaling with his Health rather then his enemies following your reasoning.

Talking about biased players who want totalk about balance...

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=44Qgl98f,comment-id=00030000000000000002,timestamp=2015-11-15T08:11:46.069+0000)
>
> It's not about me wanting to call it a bug, it was a bug and a severe one since you could spam everything at once when you were not intended to do so (and that means that Zed was balanced around not being able to do that), I guess we should have let Garen deal damage scaling with his Health rather then his enemies following your reasoning.
> 
> Talking about biased players who want totalk about balance...

You should go back and read the part after that. When you remove a bug that is a big part of a champion's kit, is IS a nerf. And if you think Zed needed a nerf in his current state, you're the biased one:

> [{quoted}](name=Alpharite,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=44Qgl98f,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-14T21:22:08.624+0000)
>
> The ignorance is fucking incredible. His Q Shadow combo was made clunky as hell. Call it a bug if you want, it added a lot of power to Zed's kit and he recieved no compensation for being nerfed at a time that he clearl doesn't need nerfs.
> 
> And I was never referring to nerfs before that, but if you want to go that far back then you should know that the .5 second delay after Death Mark is a massive nerf lategame, which Zed is bad at anyway.

I used to main Zed but this nerf made him fucking unplayable. It don't get why they changed the WQ, nobody was complaining about it... It made all his kit smoother. Now it's just terrible.
Riven got the Tiamat changes, so that's something.

> [{quoted}](name=TurquoiseYoshi,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=44Qgl98f,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2015-11-14T21:45:16.047+0000)
>
> Riven got the Tiamat changes, so that's something.

Saying just Riven got hit by that nerf is so incorrect, Fiora and Kha also got kicked in the nads with the cleave removal.

Then again, they've been kicking Kha in the nads at least once a month since his launch.

He's now more of a "She" than a "He".

True, but so did every other champ who used that as well. It's not really a nerf on one champ if multiple champs loses just as much as the champ the nerf was intended for. it would be like removing {{item:3075}}s' passive cause {{champion:33}} builds off it so well.

Tiamat changes are kind of a buff, because previously if you bought an early tiamat you didn't have the option to freeze your wave. Now, you can buy Tiamat to push when they leave lane, but freeze while they're there.
if you trying to freeze lane you just didnt buy tiamat.

For some champs (Renekton comes to mind immediately) the Tiamat is an important part of their combo. It does give you more all-in power with the active, so there's nothing wrong with rushing it - you can just make it in more situations without screwing your lane over, which I'm totally fine with.
Face it the Edge system was just confusing.

not really, if the bar was full she got her bonus 10% damage, if not then she doesn't get it. Then the way it interacted with her ult made it so she couldn't activate her ult and sit on her wind slash till the last minute if she wants to do some real damage, but at the same time was set up so you can't just use it and and keep your ult going. It gave a way for people to know when to be cause and when they could go into farm instead of constantly being worried she's going poke you to death with her combo. If anything it just needed some tweaks to get it balanced out.
They said they're probably gonna nerf him some more, which gave me an orgasm when I read it.
i agree buff yasuo
Lul, it's cute how you think Riot will actually nerf their bby grill Yasuo.
Personaly, i think that the keystone mastery should be changed completely. It's totaly op and it will result in yasuo getting nerfed again... i don't want yasuo to get nerfed again.
hes super strong... he needs a nerf not even joking
He is super strong right now, but it's in large part due to the new items and masteries. Nobody wants another champion to get Sejuani'd.
I mean, if it's Yasuo, I wouldn't be too upset. I've seen him enough for the next few patches, and he was strong enough and popular before this patch, anyway.
Even if they're annoying, no champion should be rendered unplayable.
Sej is still usable, just worse than everyone in her niche at everything except engage.
And in all honesty, in Yolo Q what more do you need than a blatantly obvious "ENGAGE NOW" like her ult does?
True, although sometimes it takes a quick second to understand what's going on, and by then the ult has worn off. That's why I can't play Orianna.

That's why I like (or rather, liked) her as a niche support for ADCs that love to get in close, like Urgot or Graves.  Or ADCs with atrocious early games (like Twitch).

You'd get to late game and put the damn ball on the tank, or kept it 24/7 on your ADC and followed them literally everywhere they went.

I really don't think Riot thought that keystone mastery through. When you make several different items give crit chance to the point you get 100% crit, it's obviously going to be overpowered, even more so on champs like {{champion:23}} who are already based around crits and healing himself.

> [{quoted}](name=Blue Moon Wolf,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=44Qgl98f,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-11-14T23:03:44.005+0000)
>
> I really don't think Riot thought that keystone mastery through. When you make several different items give crit chance to the point you get 100% crit, it's obviously going to be overpowered, even more so on champs like {{champion:23}} who are already based around crits and healing himself.

ikr
Yas isn't getting nerfed, but the crit mastery is being changed to only heal and give the AS boost when a champion is crit.
It's a joke. Laugh and move on.
I can't find it anywhere
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

He might not even last until 5.23.

Warlord's Bloodlust is getting hotfix nerfed this patch.

> [{quoted}](name=Kamquats,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=44Qgl98f,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-11-14T17:55:13.184+0000)
>
> He might not even last until 5.23.
> 
> Warlord's Bloodlust is getting hotfix nerfed this patch.

Yay for only working against champions. :D
his 100% crit with 2 items will help him
